The statistic cited by Michael McCaul is: OECD) for U.S. federal corporate tax, excluding state and local taxes.
The Council on Foreign Relations: an independent and nonpartisan think-tank, confirms that the U.S. has the highest corporate tax rate in the world when considering both federal and state/local taxes, with rates of 35 percent and 39.2 percent respectively.
A report by the Washington: based Tax Foundation in 2011, which considered federal-plus-state/local rates weighted to reflect the economies' sizes, also ranked the U.S. as having the highest corporate tax rate among advanced industrialized countries.
The OECD: s statutory corporate tax rates for 2012 also support the claim that the U.S. has one of the highest corporate tax rates in the world.
